item.title: Inheritance and super() - Object Oriented Programming
item.author: xxxx
item.description: _s_uper() is a feature through which inherited methods can be accessed, which has been overridden in a class. It can also help with the MRO lookup order in case of multiple inheritance. This may not be obvious first, but a few examples should help to drive the point home. Inheritance and method overloading was discussed in a previous post, where we saw how inherited methods can be overloaded or enhanced in the child classes.
